overview.system_description: U.S. visas are broadly divided into Non-Immigrant visas (temporary) and Immigrant visas (for permanent residence)

visa_integrity_fee.refund_conditions: Refundable under strict conditions (obey visa terms, do not overstay more than 5 days after I-94 expiration)

interview_waiver_changes.requirement: Most non-immigrant visa applicants (H, L, F, M, J, O) require in-person interviews
interview_waiver_changes.age_exemption: Removed - even applicants under 14 or over 79 must generally interview

visitor_business.passport_validity: Usually must be valid for at least 6 months beyond intended stay
visitor_business.validity_entries: Multiple entry possible; depends on consular decision
visitor_business.duration_of_stay: Determined by CBP at port of entry (often up to 6 months)
required_documents: Evidence of ties to home country
special_conditions: No employment allowed on B visas
Overstay or misrepresentation can lead to bans or future visa denial

student.validity: Tied to the duration of the program + possible grace period

dependents.types: F-2 / M-2 visas for spouse or children

special_notes: Intent to return home may be scrutinized

exchange_visitor.passport_validity: At least 6 months beyond stay generally required
exchange_visitor.validity: Based on DS-2019 form (program duration) + grace period

dependents.work_authorization: J-2 may apply for work authorization via Form I-765

exchange_visitor.special_conditions: Some J-1 visa holders subject to 2-year home-residence requirement

work.validity_duration: Depends on petition; often 1-3 years initially, renewable

dependents.work_authorization: Depends (e.g., H-4 EAD possible in some cases)

special_notes: Visa is employer-specific (tied to the sponsoring employer)
Risk of denial if petition invalid or applicant does not meet eligibility

other_non_immigrant.fees: Varies by subclass + possibly Integrity Fee

fees.petition_fees: USCIS petition fees + immigrant visa application costs
fees.integrity_fee: Usually applies to non-immigrant, not immigrant

immigrant_visas.passport_validity: Must be valid; typically 6 months beyond as required by consulate

processing.timeline: Depends on visa category, country, quota backlog

special_notes: After visa, holder becomes Lawful Permanent Resident ('Green Card')
Some visa categories (like EB-visa) have long waiting times due to quota

general_requirements.passport_validity: Generally must be valid at least 6 months beyond intended stay
general_requirements.dependents: Spouse/children usually need separate visa applications

processing_logistics.interviews: As of September 2, 2025, most non-immigrant visa applicants need in-person interviews
processing_logistics.administrative_processing: Some visas may go into 'administrative processing' causing delays
processing_logistics.passport_return: Via pickup or courier (depending on consulate)
processing_logistics.compliance: Visa holders must comply with visa conditions (stay duration, no unauthorized work)

common_denial_reasons: Weak proof of ties to home country
tips: Pay the Integrity Fee if applicable and keep proof
Maintain compliance during visa validity for possible refund of Integrity Fee
